record.title: AUTHORIZING THE CLERK TO MAKE CORRECTIONS IN ENGROSSMENT OF H.R. 1227, GULF COAST HURRICANE HOUSING RECOVERY ACT OF 2007

speaking.paragraph: Mr. Speaker, I ask unanimous consent to correct a clerical error in the passage of the recommittal amendment to H.R. 1227.

record.chair: Is there objection to the request of the gentleman from Massachusetts?

speaking.paragraph: Mr. Speaker, reserving the right to object, could the gentleman explain his request?

Mr. Speaker, I will explain it. We had talked to members of the minority. In the engrossment of H.R. 1227, the Clerk made some clerical errors. We were notified; the staff of the Committee on Financial Services talked to the minority staff. This is a request to correct some errors that were made in the recommit.
It is not in any favor to us. If you want the thing uncorrected, go ahead and object.
If I may, Mr. Speaker, I am just not recalling that.
Well, I don't expect the gentleman to recall it. I did not recall it either. We didn't know they made clerical errors. They didn't tell us they made clerical errors.
Mr. Speaker, it is an innocent question. And the clerical error was?

Mr. Speaker, if the gentleman would yield to me, I don't know what the clerical error was. We were notified that there was an error in the transcription. We did not know what the error was. Members of our staff spoke to the minority staff on the Financial Services Committee and explained it. I don't know how they mistyped it. I wasn't there when they did it. I don't know what the clerical error is. I wasn't particularly concerned. We thought it was routine.
If the minority wants the bill to go uncorrected, that is the minority's choice. We did speak to the staff beforehand.
Would the gentleman be willing to withdraw the unanimous consent request?
I will withdraw it, but I am not sticking around to make it again.
Mr. Speaker, I withdraw the request, and let it stand uncorrected.
